p: In this review, we discuss the efficacy of volatiles (single compounds) and essential oils (EOs, group of compounds) produced by plants to control food-borne bacteria ( Salmonella spp., Escherichia coli, and Listeria) and fruit pathogens (mainly Botrytis and Colletotrichum) on extending the shelf life of small fruits, such as strawberries ( Fragaria Ã— ananassa Duch), raspberries ( Rubus spp.), blueberries ( Vaccinium spp.) and grapes ( Vitis vinifera L.). We also provide insight into their in vitro, in vivo (in storage) and In situ (in the field) applications, and their mechanisms of action. A summary of the papers reviewed is presented in Table 1.
